intro: Cephaelis tontaneoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The flowers produce small, three-lobed fruits that contain several seeds.
